step.context: \text{Which of the following definitions of }\left|x+2\right|\\ \text{is correct?}
step.reason: \left|x+2\right| = -\left(x+2\right)\text{ when }x+2 \lt 0\implies x\lt-2\\ \begin{align} \text{Similarly }\left|x+2\right| =\left(x+2\right)\text{ when }&x+2\geq 0\\ &\implies x\geq -2 \end{align}\\ \text{Hence, the interval }\left[-5,5\right]\text{is broken in two at}\\ x=-2

step.context: \text{Has the integral }A = \int_{5}^{-5} \left|x+2\right|dx \text{ been}\\ \text{re - written correctly below?}\\
step.reason:
f \left(x\right) = \left|x+2\right| \text{ is computed differently in}\\ [-5,2) \text{ and }[-2,5]\\ \begin{align} \text{So, }A &= \int_{-5}^{5}f \left(x\right).dx\\ &=\int_{-5}^{-2}f_1 \left(x\right).dx + \int_{-2}^{5}f_2 \left(x\right).dx\\ \end{align}\\
\text{Where }f_1 \left(x\right) = -\left(x+2\right)\text{ and }f_2 \left(x\right) = \left(x+2\right)
